results.title: A Town like Alice
results.creator_credit: Henry Crawford, Crawford Productions and David Stevens
results.brief_description: Based on Nevil Shute’s best selling novel, “A Town Like Alice” is set against the brutal chaos of World War 11 and centres on two prisoners of war an Englishwoman, Jean Paget and an Australian soldier Joe Harmon, whose romance begins during the takeover of Malaya in World War 11 and takes them to the vast Australian outback.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Crawford, Crawford Productions and David Stevens

results.title: Better Wine Enjoyment
results.brief_description: Better Wine Enjoyment By the Experts, takes the viewer to Australia’s most famous vineyards, as well as some of the smaller wineries, seeking out the secrets of good wine from the winemakers themselves. Presented by Collin Segelov, it starts with the history of winemaking in Australia and then moves to the art of growing the fruit and making the wine. Once in a bottle, it proceeds to teach the viewer how to taste, choose, drink and

results.title: Robert's story [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Robert Weston and ACMI
results.brief_description:
A trip down memory lane for Robert Weston as he reminisces about family, his childhood, fishing and hunting, and living on the land in the bush.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: I'm home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ron Briggs and ACMI
results.brief_description: Identity is the most important thing to Ron Briggs. He talks about his father, his family and the traumatic experiences of being part of the stolen generation which separated him not only from his parents but also from his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ron Briggs and ACMI

results.title: From the beginning to the resistances
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Mick Edwards and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Me, my family, my nan - my mob.’ This is Mick Edwards’ story of separation, of a stolen generation or in Edwards’ words, “the kidnapped generation” and of healing and family and reunion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Mick Edwards and ACMI

results.title: Streets of Fitzroy [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Mick Booth
results.brief_description:
Mick Booth was brought up in Kent Street, Fitzroy - an inner suburb of Melbourne. This is his story of childhood memories, family and growing up in Fitzroy.
In English language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Mick Booth

results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fan Chen and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fan Chen and ACMI
